column2: The Document Controller/ Project Support is responsible for the coordination of records and information from creation/receipt through processing, distribution, organization, storage and retrieval, and ultimate disposition.          Ensure documentation is systematically managed and aligned with SBM Document Management Systems and processes. As Document Controller/ Project Support, provide guidance and support to Project Management teams, internal staff, Vendors and Clients when needed. Also responsible for document coordination efforts and effective technical writing in the creation of documented procedures.                      RESPONSIBILITIES               Project setup          Take ownership to define and develop scope by understanding and evaluating the project requirements.      Communicate and promote the understanding of the scope, document control strategy, constraints and ways of working to Stakeholders.      Ensure the Project Team is aware of document requirements and specifications to meet project needs, SBM standards, and Industry Regulations              Assigned activities in project support          Understand and complete assigned tasks with accuracy within agreed time frame      Identify areas requiring more detailed instructions and clarify understanding/expectation as necessary      Coordinate, plan and monitor (technical) support of documents for internal and external distribution      Escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate Stakeholder to minimize delays in deliverables              Effective interface management          Understand how assigned tasks will affect all Stakeholders; provide timely and accurate input to Stakeholders in support of requirements in meeting deadlines      Proactively highlight concerns as they arise, and prioritize assigned activities to meet key milestones      Network with Stakeholders to serve as a source of support in executing project deliverables; ensure proactive two-way communication      Produce consistent/organized documents in a well-structured format to clearly convey required information      Coordinate with Vendors, Third Party consultants, etc. to ensure timely review of documents and that comments are made with required quality level      Knowledge sharing & gaining successful cross-functional collaborations      Provide accurate and detailed information when escalating to next level      Pro-actively approach involved colleagues to get feedback and updates in order to accurately inform Manager on progress made and status      Inform and educate your colleagues on cross-functional topics encountered              Quality and timely deliverables concerning document controlling          Ensure activities are completed with consistency and in compliance with project requirements and applicable Codes, Standards and Regulation      Ensure documents are well-structured to clearly convey required information      Liaise with external Parties in order to monitor their progress and expedite when required      Be self-motivated to improve technical competencies for current and future work assignments      Promote continuous improvement by maintaining/sharing the latest Industry developments      Apply and capture applicable Lessons Learned in the execution of activities to enable information sharing, increase project efficiencies, and support/develop best practices      Ensure proper level of checks for all deliverables prior to submission; attention to detail                REQUIREMENTS               Excellent computer skills.      At least 6 years of relevant experience.     Key behaviours:      Attention to detail      Time Management/Multi-tasked      Effective communication skills      Great organizational skills      Ability to see the Big Picture      Demonstrates accountability/takes ownership      Takes initiative/self starter      Computer savvy      Ability to manage unexpected outcomes

column2: The Document Controller/ Project Support is responsible for the coordination of records and                      information from creation/receipt through processing, distribution, organization, storage and retrieval,                      and ultimate disposition. You ensure documentation is systematically managed and aligned with the                      Company s (Document) Management Systems and processes.                      As Document Controller/ Project Support, you provide guidance and support to Project Management                      teams, internal staff, vendors, subcontractors and clients when needed.                      You are also responsible for document coordination efforts and effective technical writing in the                      creation of documented procedures.                      You apply and uphold SBM s policies and procedures in support of the respective population with a                      high degree of customer focus, discretion and confidentiality.                          ROLE CONTRIBUTION                                                1. In order that the Project setup is properly defined and planned, you are to:                      1.1. Take ownership to define and develop scope by understanding and evaluating the project                      requirements.                      1.2. Communicate and promote the understanding of the scope, document control strategy,                      constraints and ways of working to stakeholders.                      1.3. Define all tasks and activities to be performed on the project                      1.4. Ensure the project team is aware of document requirements and specifications to meet                  project needs, Company standards, and industry regulations                      The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:                        Development of effective project setup plan                      Demonstrated understanding of scope and schedule                      Quality of administrative duties                        Minimal disruptions to the project activities                              ?                                         2. In order that assigned activities in project support are completed successfully, you are to:                              ?                                 2.1. Understand and complete assigned tasks with accuracy within agreed time frame                      2.2. Identify areas requiring more detailed instructions and clarify understanding/expectation as                      necessary                      2.3. Coordinate, plan and monitor (technical) support of documents for internal and external                      distribution                      2.4. Escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate stakeholder to minimize delays in deliverables                      2.5. Ensure good house-keeping of deliverables                              ?                                 3. In order to achieve effective interface management, you are to:                              ?                                 3.1. Understand how assigned tasks will affect all stakeholders; provide timely and accurate input                      to stakeholders in support of requirements in meeting deadlines                      3.2. Proactively highlight concerns as they arise, and prioritize assigned activities to meet key                      milestones                      3.3. Network with stakeholders to serve as a source of support in executing project deliverables;                      ensure proactive two-way communication                      3.4. Produce consistent/organized documents in a well-structured format to clearly convey                      required information                      3.5. Coordinate with vendors, subcontractors, third party consultants, etc to ensure timely review                  of documents and that comments are made with required quality level                              ?                                 4. In order to ensure knowledge sharing & gaining successful cross-functional collaborations                  within the community, you are to:                              ?                                 4.1. Provide accurate and detailed information when escalating to next level                      4.2. Pro-actively approach involved colleagues to get feedback and updates in order to accurately                      inform manager on progress made and status                      4.3. Inform and educate your colleagues on cross-functional topics encountered                              ?                                 5. To ensure quality and timely deliverables concerning document controlling, you are to:                              ?                                 5.1. Ensure activities are completed with consistency and in compliance with project requirements                      and applicable codes, standards and regulation                      5.2. Ensure documents are well-structured to clearly convey required information                      5.3. Liaise with external parties in order to monitor their progress and expedite when required                      5.4. Be self-motivated to improve technical competencies for current and future work assignments                      5.5. Promote continuous improvement by maintaining/sharing the latest industry developments                      5.6. Apply and capture applicable lessons learned in the execution of activities to enable                      information sharing, increase project efficiencies, and support/develop best practices                      5.7. Ensure proper level of checks for all deliverables prior to submission; attention to detail

column2: Minimum 2 - 3 years experience in residential, commercial, or both, must have done development approvals review, coordination, etc         Investment Risk Monitoring - Construction Approvals and compliance review         Detailed understanding of building approval processes and timelines, applicable FAR / FSI understanding.     Review of approvals required for a construction project.     Estimate the cost to procure those approvals.     Review the proposed development plan of the project and comment upon the additional FSI requirements to achieve the same. Highlight the source of such additional FSI and possibility of achieving the same.     Prepare / review the area statement of the project shared by developer.     Review of approved drawings v/s on site construction at site     Compare as build drawings with OC drawings and highlight deviation.     Prepare a buildability statement for a project. Highlight status of offsets, fire pathway and other critical margins     Compare approvals received with RERA portal data.     Review of approval documents received and interpret the conditions mentioned therein, if any     Keep updates about latest changes in regulations and any notifications regarding the same.     Support team with project monitoring in terms of cost review, schedule review, approvals review, sales and collection review.     Conduct site visits for TDD monitoring assignments.     The candidate shall largely be involved in execution of assignments, coordination with other consultants (if any), account management during duration of the assignment, ensuring the deliverable quality and process management.             Skill Sets Required:           Strong interpersonal and organizational skills          Strong project management skills         Requires expert knowledge of all municipal approvals and NOCs required for construction.          Thorough knowledge on Development Regulations and various approvals required for residential, Commercial and township    projects.     Requires expert level analytical and quantitative skills.       Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret the complex business documents.        Ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues.             Qualification and Experience:         bachelors in Architecture / BE Civil + Masters in Architecture / Construction Management     Minimum 2 - 3 years experience in residential / commercial/ or both

column2: If you are an Engineer / Document Controller professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you     Be a member of Centre of Excellence (CoE) Customer Care team to support the Project Management team by providing on time submittals of project documents.              In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:         Documentation collection and distribution for Tier 2 and Tier 3 projects from factory and customer vice versa.     Prepare cover pages for documents manage the transmittal of documents between Emerson and our customers on projects.     Ensure documents are submitted and received on time, as well as correctly stored in Emerson s document repository/ equivalent folders.     Regularly providing Project Document Status Report to customer Project Managers     Manufacturing Record Book / Final Data Book preparation and management with team until final payment receipt.     On time documentation creation and submittal in line with agreed (Emerson Document Delivery Index) EDDI.     Effective communication to the customer and the PMO organization on documentation status and inquiries.     Contact the customer and internal resources to expedite overdue documents needing to be prepared or approved.     Upload documents to our customers through their Document Management portals or send via email.     Communicate effectively with all stakeholders for Tier 2 and Tier 3 projects including customers, project management team, and documentation teams.     Maintain detailed status of documents in EDDI/VDRL.( Vendor Document Register List)         Who You Are:       You take action quickly and critically in constantly fast paced and unexpected situations. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities. You build partnerships and collaborative work to meet the target objectives set by the team.           For This Role, You Will Need:         Good assertive communication skills (strong written verbal in English language)     Proficient with MS Office Tools (ie Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)     Ability to establish priorities and multitask.     Awareness about ERP Software will be an added advantage.     Awareness about Document Management software s like Doc Pro will be an added advantage.     Strong organizational and detailed orientation skills, tech-savvy.     Ability to comprehend technical details/technical literacy.     Demonstrated teamwork or ability to work in a team environment.     Should be detailed and an assertive character. Must be able to manage complex situations under pressure. column2: The role is responsible for all aspects of standard scheduling functions, including but not limited to, schedule development, administration, maintenance, progressing, reporting, benchmarking and interactions with the following teams: Project and/or Turnaround Planning, Contractor Scheduling Resources, and Strategic Implementation Planning.        Job Description:          What you will deliver         Provides visible safety leadership throughout bp Solutions on and off-site     Create and maintain resource loaded schedules to align and advise the TAR & Projects Portfolio at the correct level of detail     Build and maintain resource loaded schedules to align and inform the TAR & Projects Portfolio at the correct level of detail     Supports the creation of the schedule and ensures the accuracy of the scope and execution strategy; ensuring full understanding of cost estimate basis, scope, contracting strategy and execution plan.     Provides scheduling support to the overall organisational change (trending and MoC) process; ensuring it is rigorously applied to all changes and that impacts are fully assessed and incorporated into schedule forecasts that meets the standards of all collaborators in the Cost Controls, Planning, Projects, TAR, and Procurement organizations     Ensures that schedule and progress related data is collected from project execution /TAR planning team(s), contractors, and is baselined.     Implements the site schedule norms required to develop a schedule including; engineering, construction and fabrication labour hours, and productivities.     Evaluates and highlights the schedule risks and opportunities generated by the (deterministic or probabilistic) schedule contingency to ensure the schedule accurately reflects the scale and magnitude of the risks.     Perform Primavera Administration responsibilities     Leads the review of contractor developed scheduling work, ensuring consistency against requirements     Supports scheduling assurance in accordance with the projects common process     Supports TAR assurance in accordance with the TAR common process     Closely monitor performance against realistic targets (baselines) to ensure that objectives and KPI s are met and create action plans or corrective actions to address variances     Consolidate, review, and publish all schedule data needed for pre-reads for readiness reviews that require schedule data to complete the review. Participate in all readiness reviews as the Scheduling SME             What you will need to be successful              Must have educational qualifications:         Engineering, Business Management, Construction Management, or other relevant technical degree             Preferred education/certifications:          Project Management Professional, Schedule Management Professional, AACE, RICS, Charted Engineer             Minimum years of relevant experience:         +2 years             Total years of experience:         2-12 Years             Must have experiences/skills (To be hired with):         Extensive Primavera software experience     Demonstrate strong communication, interpersonal, and administrative skills     Experience working with engineering contractors to facilitate and produce detailed engineering schedules and interface those engineering activities with procurement, permitting, and construction activities     Prior experience with critical path scheduling     Ability to work independently, think creatively and analytically, and make quick and sound decisions     Requires understanding of work breakdown structure, critical path analyses, bar charts, and task sequencing techniques     Understands and knows the impact of the Planning, Permitting, Procurement, and Field Execution processes     Understanding of cost control, estimating, and scheduling terminology and techniques     Must have excellent social skills and ability to relate to and work with personnel across the organization     Understanding of schedule risk analysis principles and software             Desired experience/skills:         Oil and Gas / petrochemical experience     Brownfield projects or TAR experience     Power BI, data manipulation and data visualization experience     Understanding of schedule risk analysis principles and software     Prior experience working with a team of Schedulers (owner, engineering, construction)     Opportunities for multilingual - German and/or Spanish     You will work with     Unit Lead, TAR & Project Controls Manager s, TAR & Project Managers, and EPC Contractors     Central Teams that provide TAR and Project Governance     Schedulers, Cost Engineers & Estimators             You will work with         Unit Lead, TAR & Project Controls Manager s, TAR & Project Managers, and EPC Contractors     Central Teams that provide TAR and Project Governance     Schedulers, Cost Engineers & Estimators         Skills:     Change control, Commissioning, start-up and handover, Conflict Management, Construction, Cost estimating and cost control, Design development and delivery, Frameworks and methodologies, Governance arrangements, Performance management, Portfolio Management, Project and construction safety, Project execution planning, Project HSSE, Project Leadership, Project Team Management, Quality, Requirements Management, Reviews, Risk Management, Schedule and resources, Sourcing Management, Stakeholder Management, Strategy and business case, Supplier Relationship Management

column2: Support and assist regional project management teams to manage and control their documentation of customers and vendors i.e. proposals, product related issues and drawings/documents in a timely and efficient manner       Roles and Responsibilities         Maintain a Master Document Register (MDR) consisting of drawings, specifications, procedures and plans.     Examine documents such as blueprints, drawings, change orders, and specifications to verify completeness and data accuracy.     Follow-up with all the stakeholders to monitor and closure as per the schedule of due dates for drawings, specifications, software, technical manuals, and other documents.     Prepare and maintain a filing system in various collaboration platforms e.g. Aconex, SharePoint as per project requirements. This filing system allows management team to get an updated Customer Supplier issued documents as receiving, recording, and processing for internal and external organizations review and approval.     Manage the flow of correspondence in and out of the company through proper transmittals; ensure outgoing documents are accurate, comply with company standards and policies, route correspondence to correct associates; and protect and secure confidential and proprietary information.     Copy or scan materials; organize, maintain, and safeguard files and database.     Review and verify project documents for completeness, format, and compliance with contract requirements.     Submit project documentation to management team for their approval and transmit approved documents to customer.     Distribute documentation to the project team and customers for their review and comments.     Receive, distribute, and track comments received from customers.     Liaise with engineers, managers, customers, and other stakeholders to discuss the project, prepare documents, or modify contract schedules.     Liaise with document originators or engineer s liaison personnel to resolve discrepancies and compiles required changes to documents.     Update changes of computerized or manual control records; release documents and notify the affected departments.     Provide support to other departments within the framework of the project e.g. assisting flow of company info.         Minimum Qualification and Experience         Graduate in any discipline preferably from the technical background     Must have at least 7 years of experience in Document Control in engineering, manufacturing or construction.         Other skills         Adaptability to cope with diverse systems and procedures applicable to a variety of projects.     Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.     Willing and proactiveness to work under tight deadlines and taking ownership of the tasks assigned to him or her     Ability to manage the document control process independently with minimum supervision.     Ability to utilize Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc. as tools to enable effective evaluation of information and reporting to Management.         Preferred Tools:         MS Office tools: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.     Aconex, SharePoint, Team Centre, A-Site, EDMS and DEMAC

Establishing strong and clear communication within the Global Editions team, and with Pearson colleagues around the world Ensuring that all material conforms to Pearsons global editorial policy and diversity, equity, and inclusion guidelines. Making sure that content is created keeping the different cultural sensitivities of a global audience in mind Ensuring that all content is accessible for all users Desired Skills and Experience Candidates in this role are likely to have an undergraduate/postgraduate degree, higher education or Web publishing experience, a record of accomplishment, and the ability to demonstrate the right qualities to take on this exciting role, including: awareness of, and interest in, technology and application development, the World Wide Web, learning management systems, and educational publishing  excellent communication skills and an aptitude for building personal networks and strong working relationships  attention to detail and excellent organizational skills  a strong interest in higher education, education trends and instructional technology, and the ability to see and act upon business opportunities as they emerge

column2: Role Overview This role provides an opportunity to work with Pearson's latest courseware , and will involve planning, specifying, researching, commissioning, developing, managing, and testing assigned Higher Education projects. Candidate in this role will work closely with colleagues in Editorial / Product Management, Production, Operations, Marketing and Sales around the world. Key Responsibilities Planning and executing a delivery strategy around scheduling, availability and enhancement of Global Edition products Working with product teams to manage discipline portfolios Demonstrating new products and prototypes at team / sales meetings and on campuses Training and developing SMEs / freelancers and managing relationships with them Overseeing work undertaken by SMEs, proofreaders, accuracy checkers, reviewers  Developing content that meets the highest quality, time, and cost standards Ensuring that all key milestones and schedules on all projects are met and proposing alternative plans to keep projects on schedule as required Creating and maintaining contracts, databases, payments and internal systems as required   Establishing strong and clear communication within the Global Editions team, and with Pearson colleagues around the world Ensuring that all material conforms to Pearsons diversity, equity, and inclusion guidelines and is created keeping the different cultural sensitivities of a global audience in mind Ensuring that all content is accessible for all users Desired Skills and Experience Candidates in this role are likely to have an undergraduate/postgraduate degree, higher education or publishing experience, a record of accomplishment, and the ability to demonstrate the right qualities to take on this exciting role, including: excellent communication skills and an aptitude for building personal networks and strong working relationships  attention to detail and excellent organizational skills  a strong interest in higher education, education trends and instructional technology, and the ability to see and act upon business opportunities as they emerge awareness of, and interest in, technology and application development, learning management systems, trends in higher education, and educational publishing

column2: Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced Document Control Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have at least 6 years of experience in document control and an ACONEX certification. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and organizing project documentation, ensuring that documents are accurate, up-to-date, and easily accessible to all stakeholders. You will work closely with project teams to support documentation processes and standards. Responsibilities: Oversee the document control process for multiple projects, ensuring compliance with company standards and regulatory requirements. Utilize ACONEX software to manage and organize project documents, including drawings, specifications, reports, and correspondence. Ensure proper storage, indexing, and retrieval of documents for easy access by project teams and other stakeholders. Maintain an up-to-date document control system, including the maintenance of databases, registers, and tracking logs. Coordinate with project teams to establish and enforce document control protocols and procedures. Review and verify documents for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with project requirements. Provide training and support to project team members on document control processes and the use of ACONEX software. Conduct regular audits to ensure documentation is accurate and up-to-date. Prepare and distribute reports and updates on document control status to project management. Support the archiving and final handover of project documentation upon project completion. Stay current with industry best practices and advancements in document control technology. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in a relevant field such as engineering or information management (preferred). Minimum of 6 years of experience in document control, with a strong understanding of documentation management principles. ACONEX certification is required. Proficient in the use of ACONEX software and other document control tools. Excellent organizational skills with a high attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with project teams and stakeholders. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements for document control. If you are a highly organized and experienced Document Control Specialist with ACONEX certification, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to the successful completion of our projects by ensuring accurate and efficient documentation management.
column11: ACONEX Expertise, Document Management, Document Control, Process Implementation, Records Management, Accuracy Focused, Compliance Standards

column2: Strategy Development and Execution: Lead the planning and execution of projects aimed at engaging and supporting content creators. Develop strategies that align with the company's goals and the creators' needs.      Team Collaboration: Work closely with the Creator Relations team to ensure smooth coordination and execution of projects. Facilitate communication between different departments to achieve project goals.      Creator Engagement: Act as a primary point of contact for content creators. Understand their needs, provide support, and foster a positive relationship with them.      Project Management: Oversee all aspects of project management, including timeline, budget, resources, and deliverables. Ensure projects are delivered on time and within scope.      Reporting and Analysis: Monitor project performance and provide regular reports to management. Analyze data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement.        Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Business, Communications, or related field.    Proven experience in project management, ideally in a digital media or content creation environment.    Strong understanding of the content creation ecosystem and digital media trends.    Excellent organizational, communication, and leadership skills.    Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.    Preferred Skills:    Project Management Professional (PMP) certification.    Experience in working with content creators or in a creator-centric organization.    Strong analytical skills with an ability to interpret data to make informed decisions.        Personal Traits:     Passionate about digital media and content creation.

column2: Your specific responsibilities may vary depending on the project, but generally include the following:       Support Management in creating Document Management System      Establish and maintain document control procedures and processes, including document numbering, revision control, and storage     Create and maintain documentation, such as manuals, policies, procedures, and work instructions     Manage the distribution of documents to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring that documents are delivered on time and to the correct recipient     Ensure that documents are properly reviewed and approved, and that all changes are properly recorded and communicated     Archive and store physical and electronic documents in accordance with company policies and procedures     Ensure that documents are easily accessible and searchable, using document management software or other tools     Provide training to employees on document control procedures and processes, as needed     Maintain document control metrics and reporting on document control activities     Accurately process and record all technical documentation in accordance with agreed procedures. Ensure agreed procedures satisfy project, client and regulatory requirements     Monitor progress of in-house and Client reviews of technical data. Monitor due dates for drawings, specifications, software, technical manuals and other documents Also Monitor the status of project to ensure documentation is submitted according to schedule     When required, input or report progress information (received from discipline engineers) accurately at regular intervals as specified by the project     Produce exception reports on late documentation for Project Management review     Undertake other tasks as required by the Lead Document Controller / Manager - Document Control     Maintain a Master Document Register (MDR) consisting of drawings, specifications, procedures and plans     Setup and maintain data in the Electronic Document Management System ERP     Manage the flow of correspondence in and out of the company through proper transmittals; ensure outgoing documents are accurate, comply with company standards and policies, route correspondence to correct associates; and protect and secure confidential and proprietary information     Review and verifies project documents for completeness, format, and compliance with contract requirements     Submit project documentation to management team for approval and transmits approved documents to customer     Provide the quality of deliverables and maintain quality records (KPIs)     Contribute to compilation of final project dossiers, as built portfolios and archiving     Ensure the entry in Lesson Learned log after completion of each project.           Your profile           Diploma or Graduate in Engineering     5- 10 years+ experience in Document Control     Experience with Sharepoint is an MUST     Experience in controlling documents using EDMS     Experience in the process industry preferred     Fluency (Verbal and written) in English is a must.       Knowledge:       Sound knowledge of acquisition methods and practices        Needed skills:       Detail oriented, with project management skills, and able to coordinate many activities     Ability to establish priorities, manage deadlines, and exercise a high degree of professionalism in interactions     Mature and smart communicator, enable to build relationships and credibility inside and outside of our organization     Result-driven, resourceful, and continuously looking for ways to improve     Appetite for getting things done     Self-motivated, confident, and passionate     Teamwork Interpersonal skills     Disciplined documentation and record-keeping skills     Flexibility and adaptability under adverse conditions     Ability to show initiative, good judgment, and resourcefulness     Ensures that regular consistent communication takes place within the area of responsibility     Real willingness to invest oneself to learn and grow.
column11: Training, ERP, Interpersonal skills, EDMS, Project documentation, Project management, Management, Document control, Document management system, Technical documentation

column2: The Document Controller/ Project Support is responsible for the coordination of records and                      information from creation/receipt through processing, distribution, organization, storage and retrieval,                      and ultimate disposition. You ensure documentation is systematically managed and aligned with the                      Company s (Document) Management Systems and processes.                      As Document Controller/ Project Support, you provide guidance and support to Project Management                      teams, internal staff, vendors, subcontractors and clients when needed.                      You are also responsible for document coordination efforts and effective technical writing in the                      creation of documented procedures.                      You apply and uphold SBM s policies and procedures in support of the respective population with a                      high degree of customer focus, discretion and confidentiality.                          ROLE CONTRIBUTION                        1. In order that the Project setup is properly defined and planned, you are to:                      1.1. Take ownership to define and develop scope by understanding and evaluating the project                      requirements.                      1.2. Communicate and promote the understanding of the scope, document control strategy,                      constraints and ways of working to stakeholders.                      1.3. Define all tasks and activities to be performed on the project                      1.4. Ensure the project team is aware of document requirements and specifications to meet                      project needs, Company standards, and industry regulations                      The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:                      Development of effective project setup plan                      Demonstrated understanding of scope and schedule                      Quality of administrative duties                      Minimal disruptions to the project activities                      2. In order that assigned activities in project support are completed successfully, you are to:                      2.1. Understand and complete assigned tasks with accuracy within agreed time frame                      2.2. Identify areas requiring more detailed instructions and clarify understanding/expectation as                      necessary                      2.3. Coordinate, plan and monitor (technical) support of documents for internal and external                      distribution                      2.4. Escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate stakeholder to minimize delays in deliverables                      2.5. Ensure good house-keeping of deliverables                      3. In order to achieve effective interface management, you are to:                      3.1. Understand how assigned tasks will affect all stakeholders; provide timely and accurate input                      to stakeholders in support of requirements in meeting deadlines                      3.2. Proactively highlight concerns as they arise, and prioritize assigned activities to meet key                      milestones                      3.3. Network with stakeholders to serve as a source of support in executing project deliverables;                      ensure proactive two-way communication                      3.4. Produce consistent/organized documents in a well-structured format to clearly convey                      required information                      3.5. Coordinate with vendors, subcontractors, third party consultants, etc. to ensure timely review                      of documents and that comments are made with required quality level                      4. In order to ensure knowledge sharing & gaining successful cross-functional collaborations                      within the community, you are to:                      4.1. Provide accurate and detailed information when escalating to next level                      4.2. Pro-actively approach involved colleagues to get feedback and updates in order to accurately                      inform manager on progress made and status                      4.3. Inform and educate your colleagues on cross-functional topics encountered                      5. To ensure quality and timely deliverables concerning document controlling, you are to:                      5.1. Ensure activities are completed with consistency and in compliance with project requirements                      and applicable codes, standards and regulation                      5.2. Ensure documents are well-structured to clearly convey required information                      5.3. Liaise with external parties in order to monitor their progress and expedite when required                      5.4. Be self-motivated to improve technical competencies for current and future work assignments                      5.5. Promote continuous improvement by maintaining/sharing the latest industry developments                      5.6. Apply and capture applicable lessons learned in the execution of activities to enable                      information sharing, increase project efficiencies, and support/develop best practices                      5.7. Ensure proper level of checks for all deliverables prior to submission; attention to detail

column2: Hill International (Middle East) Ltd is looking for Document Controller to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Document Controller is responsible for managing, organizing, and maintaining an organization's documentation and records      They play a crucial role in ensuring that documents are appropriately stored, accessible, and up-to-date      The position requires attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work effectively with different teams to facilitate efficient document management processes        Key Responsibilities:        Document Management:Receive, process, and organize various types of documents, including contracts, technical reports, correspondence, drawings, and other relevant records      Ensure all documents are correctly named, numbered, and filed in a logical and easily retrievable manner      Implement document version control to avoid confusion and maintain document history      Keep track of document approval and review processes      Document Control System:Utilize document management software or other electronic systems to manage and track documents efficiently      Provide training and support to employees on the proper use of the document control system      Ensure the document control system complies with company standards and industry regulations      Distribution and Retrieval:Manage the distribution of documents to authorized personnel, both internally and externally, while ensuring appropriate access permissions      Monitor and track document retrieval requests, ensuring timely responses and maintaining records of document movement      Quality Assurance:Perform periodic audits of documents to verify accuracy, completeness, and compliance with established procedures and standards      Report any discrepancies or non-conformities to the relevant parties and work with them to resolve issues      Document Security and Confidentiality:Ensure sensitive and confidential documents are appropriately protected and accessible only to authorized personnel      Adhere to data protection and privacy policies to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information      Collaboration:Collaborate with various departments, project teams, and stakeholders to gather and compile documentation for different projects or purposes      Facilitate effective communication and information sharing among team members      Record Retention:Manage the retention and disposal of documents in accordance with the organization's policies and legal requirements      Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for streamlining document control processes and implementing best practices      Propose and implement improvements to enhance document management efficiency        Requirements:        Bachelor's degree or equivalent qualification in a relevant field      Proven experience as a Document Controller or in a similar role      Familiarity with document management software and electronic document control systems      Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail      Strong communication and interpersonal skills
column11: Document Controller

column2: If you are an Engineer / Document Controller professional looking for an opportunity to grow, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you     Be a member of Centre of Excellence (CoE) Customer Care team to support the Project Management team by providing on time submittals of project documents.              In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:         Documentation collection and distribution for Tier 2 and Tier 3 projects from factory and customer vice versa.     Prepare cover pages for documents manage the transmittal of documents between Emerson and our customers on projects.     Ensure documents are submitted and received on time, as well as correctly stored in Emerson s document repository/ equivalent folders.     Regularly providing Project Document Status Report to customer Project Managers     Manufacturing Record Book / Final Data Book preparation and management with team until final payment receipt.     On time documentation creation and submittal in line with agreed (Emerson Document Delivery Index) EDDI.     Effective communication to the customer and the PMO organization on documentation status and inquiries.     Contact the customer and internal resources to expedite overdue documents needing to be prepared or approved.     Upload documents to our customers through their Document Management portals or send via email.     Communicate effectively with all stakeholders for Tier 2 and Tier 3 projects including customers, project management team, and documentation teams.     Maintain detailed status of documents in EDDI/VDRL.( Vendor Document Register List)         Who You Are:       You take action quickly and critically in constantly fast paced and unexpected situations. You are an active learner who uses both success and failure as learning opportunities. You build partnerships and collaborative work to meet the target objectives set by the team.           For This Role, You Will Need:         Good assertive communication skills (strong written verbal in English language)     Proficient with MS Office Tools (ie Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access)     Ability to establish priorities and multitask.     Awareness about ERP Software will be an added advantage.     Awareness about Document Management software s like Doc Pro will be an added advantage.     Strong organizational and detailed orientation skills, tech-savvy.     Ability to comprehend technical details/technical literacy.     Demonstrated teamwork or ability to work in a team environment.     Should be detailed and an assertive character. Must be able to manage complex situations under pressure.         Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:         Degree in Engineering or any other Degree with relevant experience

Inform and educate your colleagues on cross-functional topics encountered      The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:      Assessment and feedback by colleagues in day-to-day collaborations    Contribution to project procedures and work instructions          5. To ensure quality and timely deliverables concerning document controlling, you are to:      5.1. Ensure activities are completed with consistency and in compliance with project requirements    and applicable codes, standards and regulation    5.2. Ensure documents are well-structured to clearly convey required information    5.3. Liaise with external parties in order to monitor their progress and expedite when required    5.4. Be self-motivated to improve technical competencies for current and future work assignments    5.5. Promote continuous improvement by maintaining/sharing the latest industry developments    5.6. Apply and capture applicable lessons learned in the execution of activities to enable    information sharing, increase project efficiencies, and support/develop best practices    5.7. Ensure proper level of checks for all deliverables prior to submission; attention to detail              The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:      Demonstrated quality of and timely deliverables    Cost of Non-Quality due to rework    Satisfaction of Manager(s) regarding the quality and timely delivery of work              6. If acting as Lead Document Controller / Project Support, in addition, you are to:      5.1. Understand Company and project requirements and appropriately assign tasks to team members    6.2. Set team expectations for quality standards and enforce safety requirements to meet project needs, corporate standards, and industry regulations    6.3. Ensure each team member understands his/her role and responsibilities    6.4 Provide support and guidance as needed to team members: partner with direct report for mentoring staff as needed    6.5 Set yearly objectives, proactively assess team performance and partner with the direct report to continuously improve global performance as needed    6.6 Ensure previous lessons learnt are incorporated and promote continuous improvement    by sharing new lessons learnt with relevant managers    6.7 Ensure proper communication with internal/external stakeholders to ensure all parties are promptly informed

column2: NKT is looking for an enthusiastic customer-oriented Document Controller to join our team of professionals working on a complex project for high voltage cable systems based out of our office in Chennai, India.  Responsibilities: Manage Document and Communication Flow: ??Take charge of monitoring and managing the document and communication flow, from review and approval to filing and transmittal, following Document Lists. ??Keep the Project/Tender Manager updated on the status. ??Ensure all customer-related documentation receives project approval before submission. Efficient Handling of Incoming Documentation: ??Handle incoming documentation according to agreed-upon processes. ??Ensure proper control of document ID, content, and timely distribution. ??Monitor official project correspondence with external partners. Process Enhancement: ??Play a key role in continuously improving document management processes and procedures. ??Evaluate existing systems and procedures, identifying opportunities for enhancement and making recommendations. Collaboration and Stylistic Excellence: ??Collaborate effectively with various departments and managers. ??Take responsibility for setting up document management systems and processes in coordination with clients and project/tender teams. ??Ensure documents meet stylistic standards, including grammar, spelling, and layout. ??Prepare and submit final documentation packages in line with contract requirements. Requirements : We're seeking a customer-focused Document Controller who is motivated,independent, and structured in their approach to work. The ideal candidateis reliable, trustworthy, and thrives in a team-oriented environment whilealso excelling at independent work. In addition to these qualities, you should possess the following expertise: ??An academic degree, preferably in business administration,industrial management, or a technical field. ??Proficiency in tools such as M-Files, SharePoint, Adobe Acrobat DC Pro, and EDMS (Electronic Document Management Systems). ??Experience in technical documentation and a background in highvoltage cable projects would be a strong advantage. ??Flexibility and a willingness to travel domestically and internationally. Join us as ??e connect a greener world!??NKT is committed to fostering a diverse organization and a culture where people from different backgrounds can thrive and are inspired to perform at their best. We believe that a diverse organization enables sustainable performance, and that an inclusive and welcoming culture makes for a better place to work.  If you are looking for an international career in a fast-moving, growing and high-tech environment where you will be able to develop on a personal as well as on a career level, join us! We are waiting for you!

column2: 3 Ciircles Opc P Ltd is looking for Document Controller to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     A Document Controller is responsible for managing, organizing, and maintaining an organization's documentation and records     They play a crucial role in ensuring that documents are appropriately stored, accessible, and up-to-date     The position requires attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work effectively with different teams to facilitate efficient document management processes       Key Responsibilities:       Document Management:Receive, process, and organize various types of documents, including contracts, technical reports, correspondence, drawings, and other relevant records     Ensure all documents are correctly named, numbered, and filed in a logical and easily retrievable manner     Implement document version control to avoid confusion and maintain document history     Keep track of document approval and review processes     Document Control System:Utilize document management software or other electronic systems to manage and track documents efficiently     Provide training and support to employees on the proper use of the document control system     Ensure the document control system complies with company standards and industry regulations     Distribution and Retrieval:Manage the distribution of documents to authorized personnel, both internally and externally, while ensuring appropriate access permissions     Monitor and track document retrieval requests, ensuring timely responses and maintaining records of document movement     Quality Assurance:Perform periodic audits of documents to verify accuracy, completeness, and compliance with established procedures and standards     Report any discrepancies or non-conformities to the relevant parties and work with them to resolve issues     Document Security and Confidentiality:Ensure sensitive and confidential documents are appropriately protected and accessible only to authorized personnel     Adhere to data protection and privacy policies to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information     Collaboration:Collaborate with various departments, project teams, and stakeholders to gather and compile documentation for different projects or purposes     Facilitate effective communication and information sharing among team members     Record Retention:Manage the retention and disposal of documents in accordance with the organization's policies and legal requirements     Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for streamlining document control processes and implementing best practices     Propose and implement improvements to enhance document management efficiency

column2: srmb srijan ltd is looking for HR Professional to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.An HR Professional is responsible for executing various human resources (HR) functions within an organization. Key responsibilities include:     Recruiting and staffing: sourcing, screening, and hiring new employees.     Employee relations: addressing and resolving employee concerns, complaints, and conflicts.     Performance management: conducting performance evaluations and providing feedback to employees.     Employee development: creating and implementing employee training programs and career development plans.     Compensation and benefits: administering employee compensation and benefits programs, such as salaries, bonuses, and insurance.     Compliance: ensuring compliance with federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Policy development and administration: creating, updating, and communicating HR policies and procedures.     Employee records management: maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee files and records.     Diversity and inclusion: promoting and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace culture.     Other HR-related tasks as assigned by management.       Qualifications:       Strong knowledge of federal and state employment laws and regulations.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.     Good organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.     Experience with HR information systems (HRIS) and other HR technology solutions.     Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive employee information.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve HR-related issues.

column2: Lead PLM services globally and provides technical and administrative support to one or more TDP, PDP, sustaining and/or BI projects.                As a      document control specialist     on the      PLM     team, you will join a      team of      ERP engineers that work in a cross-functional,      collaborative     and blame-free environment. Your role will      be responsible for     PLM applications and tool development, configuration, customization, upgrade, including implementation and rollout of new releases.                     The candidate will      be responsible for     managing and handling the PLM Support      services by     properly guiding and      monitoring     a team of PLM support consultants/     engineers     .      He     /She     will be      mainly responsible     for:                         Ensure smooth support in      PLM                     Driving efficiency and improvements in our business processes                     System enhancement and development as per customers needs/requirements                     Required coordination with      global PLM/support     team                     Regular and frequent interaction with Customers                         The candidate      should have     6 ~      8     years of working experience in PLM/PDM domain having worked in the following modules/area:                         Product      Development                     Change Management                     Life Cycle     Management                     Document Control                     Product Configuration and Variant Management                     PLM > SAP interface and CAD integration will be further value addition     .                         What You Need                 Expertise     in PLM. Develop and      maintain     deep      expertise     in PLM Windchill document revision control application.                  Work with Documentation Services and      R&D     for adherence to processes and the use of PLM to house Quality System documentation and Quality Records. Work with      R&D     and others in the organization to report issues, provide input for improvements (through creation or review of      Requirements), functional testing during      product life cycle and      testing for processes involving PLM.                  Support PLM Document Control for      Stryker     R&D Projects. Includes creation of CRs, reviewing/editing documents for revision control in referenced documents, preparing documents for inputting to PLM,      maintaining     clean DHFs, linking documents and projects to other projects.      Range     of documentation will be DHF, DMR, Functional, and Journal for PDP projects. For TDP, BI, and SE projects,      additional     documentation will be supported. May include training others in PLM.                  Expertise     in the use of PLM as related to Quality System. Knowledge and use of all Quality System SOPs and Work Instructions that must be followed by R&D staff to create and      maintain     documentation in PLM.                  Support of Audit Readiness     .      Includes Back-Room participation, creation of tools for R&D, pre-audit prep of documents, creating/     maintaining     PLM infrastructure to support business practices and audit tools (documents, proof-books; linkages), and maintenance of clean DHFs in PLM.                 Communicate throughout the Organization. Ensure      good communication     with R&D Staff and department manager for workload monitoring/prioritization (weekly) and support excellent communication across assigned Core/Extended Teams, including communication among R&D sites and with various GQO team members across GQO sites.                  Build Quality      into     all aspects of their work by      maintaining     compliance      to     all quality requirements.               Minimum Qualifications (Required):               B.S. degree in engineering or applicable technical field (mechanical or biomedical preferred)     having 6 ~ 10 years of working experience in PLM/PDM      domain
